es.ucm.fdi.control

Class Controller

  • java.lang.Object
    • es.ucm.fdi.control.Controller

  • public class Controller
extends java.lang.Object
    Author:
    Pablo and Diego Class Controller which stores the information about the input and output streams and invokes the trafficSimulatoronce is established the number of ticks

      boolean loadEvents(java.io.InputStream inStream)
      Loads an Ini file, first construct an instance of class Ini from the inStream, then try to parse each ini section in ini.getSections(), by calling their parse method of the Event, the first one that succeeds will return an event.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Controller

        public Controller(TrafficSimulator ts)
        Constructor of the class, assigns to the class attribute TrafficSimulator the one passed as parameter.
        Parameters:
        ts - traffic simulator which will be use in order to simulate the behave of the application.

      • Controller

        public Controller(TrafficSimulator ts,
                  java.io.OutputStream output)
        Constructor of the class, this time also with the outstream as output parameter.
        Parameters:
        ts - traffic simulator which will be use in order to simulate the behave of the application.
        output - outstream which is use to show the information resulted from the application.

    • Method Detail

      • setEventBuilders

        public void setEventBuilders(EventBuilder[] eventBuilders)
        Setter of the class attribute eventBuilder.
        Parameters:
        eventBuilders - new event builder of the controller.

      • getEventBuilders

        public EventBuilder[] getEventBuilders()
        Getter of the class attribute eventBuilder.
        Returns:
        the current event builder of the class.

      • run

        public void run()
        Reads the events and send them to the simulator in order to run the application.
        Throws:
        SimulatorError - in case the simulation has thrown any exception during the loading, here it will be catch.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets the simulator, starting a new simulation, probably will be use in the GUI.

      • setOutputStream

        public void setOutputStream(java.io.OutputStream outStream)
        Setter of the class attribute outStream.
        Parameters:
        outStream - new output flow to display the result of the simulation.

      • run

        public void run(int ticks)
        Receives as parameter the number of steps(ticks) that the simulation will last.
        Parameters:
        ticks - number of ticks meanwhile the simulation will be run.

      • loadEvents

        public boolean loadEvents(java.io.InputStream inStream)
        Loads an Ini file, first construct an instance of class Ini from the inStream, then try to parse each ini section in ini.getSections(), by calling their parse method of the Event, the first one that succeeds will return an event.
        Parameters:
        inStream - stream which contains the set of events in INI format.
        Throws:
        SimulatorError - if there is an error, here it will be catch.

      • parserEvent

        public static Event parserEvent(IniSection sec)
        Will parse which is the Event from the Ini file has to be returned.
        Parameters:
        sec - Ini file to be parsed.
        Returns:
        the event to be added in the event loading process.
